channel.title: PI How to edit the client's tab ID's
channel.description:
I know I have to go to my client's client.java, but I've tried everything to fix it. Skype is iamjmperry
http://i.imgur.com/NoCVs.jpg
http://i.imgur.com/YMYpW.jpg
WITH CODES - http://i.imgur.com/xaGvA.jpg These are slightly different http://i.imgur.com/yLofS.jpg

item.title: PI How to edit the client's tab ID's
item.dc:creator: @justinmperry justinmperry
item.description:
@justinmperry wrote:

Dude thanks so much, I took away the /* and */ around all of it, and it worked. If you don’t mind, do you think you can add me on skype, for if i ever need help? iamjmperry

Read full topic
item.source: PI How to edit the client's tab ID's

item.title: PI How to edit the client's tab ID's
item.dc:creator: @mista_pnut mista pnut
item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

Looking at your code, that whole piece of code is commented out.

You’re using a stream comment around the whole piece of code, therefor none of that code is read while the program is running.

So, your tabs are being swapped somewhere else it seems like, so either find how those tabs are being called for or just uncomment what you have and see if everything works fine.

If you’re unsure of what a stream comment is, here you go: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comment_(computer_programming)#Java

Read full topic
item.source: PI How to edit the client's tab ID's

item.title: PI How to edit the client's tab ID's
item.dc:creator: @justinmperry justinmperry
item.description:
@justinmperry wrote:

[quote=“mista pnut, post:3, topic:470686”]Search for a void something similar to this (May have a different name or int format/names, that’s why I’m posting the void)

public void setSidebarInterface(int menuId, int form) { outStream.createFrame(71); outStream.writeWord(form); outStream.writeByteA(menuId); }

Once you’ve found your converted void, you should be able to find where the clan chat tab is and add this.
setSidebarInterface(7, -1); // clan chat

Use the same method for the logout button.

You may need to add something like this in your clicking buttons case so you can find the action button ID for the logout one.
println(“ab=” + actionButtonId);[/quote]

I have already tried this, it still didn’t work. Look.

The top right X logout button still does nothing, and where it says setSidebarInterface(7, -1); I’ve also changed the -1 part to 18128(clan chat) http://i.imgur.com/xaGvA.jpg
It’s almost as if it’s not compiling, but I know it is, because other stuff compiles.

Read full topic
item.source: PI How to edit the client's tab ID's

item.title: PI How to edit the client's tab ID's
item.dc:creator: @mista_pnut mista pnut
item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

Search for a void something similar to this (May have a different name or int format/names, that’s why I’m posting the void)

public void setSidebarInterface(int menuId, int form) { outStream.createFrame(71); outStream.writeWord(form); outStream.writeByteA(menuId); }

Once you’ve found your converted void, you should be able to find where the clan chat tab is and add this.
setSidebarInterface(7, -1); // clan chat

Use the same method for the logout button.

You may need to add something like this in your clicking buttons case so you can find the action button ID for the logout one.
println(“ab=” + actionButtonId);

Read full topic
